questions.question_text: When an investigator contacts by telephone the domain administrator or controller listed by a Who is lookup to request all e-mails sent and received for a user account be preserved, what U.S.C. statute authorizes this phone call and obligates the ISP to preserve e-mail records?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer: D. Title 18, Section 2703(f).

The U.S code unannotated Title 18. involves crimes and criminal procedure $ 2703.
Required disclosure of customer communications or records.

a) contents of wire or electronic communication in electronic storage

b)contents of wire or electronic communications in a remote computing service

c)records concerning elctronic communication service or remote computing 

d)requirement for court order 

e)no cause of action against a provicer disclosing infromation under this chapter

f)requirement to preserve Evidence.

questions.question_text:
You are contracted to work as a computer forensics investigator for a regional bank that has four 30 TB storage area networks that store customer data.
What method would be most efficient for you to acquire digital evidence from this network?

choices.B: create a sparse data copy of a folder or file
choices.A: create a compressed copy of the file with DoubleSpace

discussion.content: I would like to agree with larajorge on this one. The answer should be A

comments.content: A disk imaging tool not necessarily will check for CRC32s and not even is a requeriment in fact, to be able to perform any kind of validation by itself. But, a DOS copy will not take those elements we will need for our investigation. So, think answer is absolutly correct.

discussion.content: I believe answer should be A. The question asks why I would recommend a disk imaging tool, it is not asking what is the issue with a DOS copy.

choices.A: A disk imaging tool would check for CRC32s for internal self-checking and validation and have MD5 checksum
choices.D: There is no case for an imaging tool as it will use a closed, proprietary format that if compared to the original will not match up sector for sector
choices.B: Evidence file format will contain case data entered by the examiner and encrypted at the beginning of the evidence file
choices.C: A simple DOS copy will not include deleted files, file slack and other information

questions.question_text: Melanie was newly assigned to an investigation and asked to make a copy of all the evidence from the compromised system. Melanie did a DOS copy of all the files on the system. What would be the primary reason for you to recommend a disk imaging tool?

You are employed directly by an attorney to help investigate an alleged sexual harassment case at a large pharmaceutical manufacture. While at the corporate office of the company, the CEO demands to know the status of the investigation. What prevents you from discussing the case with the CEO?

discussion.content: The attorney-work-product rule protects materials prepared in anticipation of litigation from being disclosed to opposing parties. Since you are employed directly by an attorney, the work you are doing falls under this protection, and discussing the case with anyone outside of the attorney-client relationship, including the CEO, could potentially compromise this protection and the integrity of the investigation.

questions.question_text:
One technique for hiding information is to change the file extension from the correct one to one that might not be noticed by an investigator. For example,
[1]
extension?

discussion.content: One technique for hiding information is to change the file extension from the correct one to one that might not be noticed by an investigator. For example, changing a .jpg extension to a .doc extension so that a picture file appears to be a document. What can an investigator examine to verify that a file has the correct extension?

comments.content: You can change the ext, of course. But file header will not change. So, if you set a .doc ext to a JPG file, file header will be FFD8FF anyway. Try by yourself: Use a JPG, open with any hex editor and have a look. Then, change the ext to .doc. Any changes to the file header? :)
So then what would your answer choice be

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
For example, one technique for hiding information is to change the file extension from the correct one to the file header. So, the correct answer is:

B. the file header
